      </section> 
    <section class="section blog-contents"> 
      <div class="pa blog-editor">
        <div class="l-container">
          <div class="be__wrapper">
            <div class="be__contents">
              <div class="be__contents-wrapper">
                <p class="wpml-ls-statics-post_translations wpml-ls">This post is also available in: 
    <span class="wpml-ls-slot-post_translations wpml-ls-item wpml-ls-item-ja wpml-ls-first-item wpml-ls-last-item wpml-ls-item-legacy-post-translations"><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.jp/dns-tunneling-in-the-wild/" class="wpml-ls-link"><span class="wpml-ls-native" lang="ja">日本語</span><span class="wpml-ls-display"><span class="wpml-ls-bracket"> (</span>Japanese<span class="wpml-ls-bracket">)</span></span></a></span></p><h2><a id="post-130578-_4lt92rr5muov"></a>Executive Summary</h2>
<p>We present a study on why and how domain name system (DNS) tunneling techniques are used in the wild. Motivated by our findings, we present a system to automatically attribute tunneling domains to tools and campaigns.</p>
<p>Attackers adopt DNS tunneling techniques to bypass security policies in enterprise networks because most enterprises implement relatively permissive policies for DNS traffic. Previous research has shown that malware campaigns such as <a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/solarstorm-supply-chain-attack-timeline/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">SUNBURST</a> and <a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/dns-tunneling-in-the-wild-overview-of-oilrigs-dns-tunneling/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">OilRig</a> use DNS tunneling for command and control (C2).</p>
<p>However, many aspects of how attackers use DNS tunneling in the wild remain unknown. For example, do they use DNS tunneling techniques exclusively for C2? How do they implement and host these techniques? Can we further analyze and provide actionable insights on DNS tunneling traffic?</p>
<p>We answer the above questions through over four years of experience in DNS tunneling traffic investigations and in-the-wild tunneling domain detections. We find that apart from threat actors using DNS tunneling techniques for C2 communication, enterprise employees are using them for censorship circumvention and vehicle passengers are using them to bypass network service charges.</p>
<p>Different tunneling domains share characteristics that can reveal the tools used to embed data onto DNS queries and responses – and the associated malware campaign name.</p>
<p>Therefore, we have built an attribution system called <a href="https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/dns-security" target="_blank" rel="noopener">DNS Security</a> System, which can gather information about the DNS tunneling traffic and provide details about the tools and the associated campaigns in real time.</p>
<p>Palo Alto Networks <a href="https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/ngfw" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Next-Generation Firewall</a> customers can access the tunneling tool and campaign information with DNS Security subscriptions.</p>
<p>Palo Alto Networks <a href="https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/ngfw" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Next-Generation Firewall</a> customers receive protections against malicious indicators (domain, IP) mentioned in this article via <a href="https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/advanced-url-filtering/administration" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Advanced URL Filtering</a> and our <a href="https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/dns-security" target="_blank" rel="noopener">DNS Security</a> subscription services.</p>
<p>Palo Alto Networks <a href="https://docs-cortex.paloaltonetworks.com/p/XDR" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Cortex XDR</a> analytics customers receive protection against DNS tunneling techniques mentioned in this article via the DNS tunneling analytics detector.</p>
<table style="width: 100%;">
<thead>
<tr>
<td style="width: 35%;"><b>Related Unit 42 Topics</b></td>
<td style="width: 100%;"><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/tag/dns-tunneling/" target=" rel=" rel="noopener"><b>DNS Tunneling</b></a>, <strong><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/tag/cobalt-strike/" target="rel=" rel="noopener">Cobalt Strike</a></strong></td>
</tr>
</thead>
</table>
<h2><a id="post-130578-_wven14kmgum2"></a>DNS Tunneling Basics</h2>
<p><strong>What is DNS tunneling</strong>? DNS tunneling is a technique to encode data of non-DNS programs and protocols within DNS queries and responses. This enables various types of communication over the DNS protocol, including file transfer, C2 and web browsing.</p>
<p><strong>Why perform DNS tunneling</strong>? DNS normally uses UDP port 53, which is usually open on clients, systems, servers and firewalls to transmit DNS queries. DNS is a fundamental component of the internet. It serves many applications, from well-known services like web browsing and email, to lesser-known services like auto-discover, load balancing, censorship and security monitoring.</p>
<p>Due to its criticality, most enterprises implement relatively permissive policies for DNS traffic. Therefore, attackers are abusing the DNS protocol to tunnel C2 communications and retrieve malware payloads.</p>
<p>Well-known attack campaigns such as <a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/solarstorm-supply-chain-attack-timeline/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">SUNBURST</a>, <a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/dns-tunneling-in-the-wild-overview-of-oilrigs-dns-tunneling/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">OilRig</a>, <a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/xhunt-campaign-backdoors/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">xHunt</a> and <a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/darkhydrus-delivers-new-trojan-that-can-use-google-drive-for-c2-communications/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">DarkHydrus</a> have employed DNS tunneling techniques. Permissive policies on DNS traffic allow attackers to reach the internet. The large amount of benign DNS traffic becomes a natural disguise for attackers to hide their footprint.</p>
<p><strong>How DNS tunneling is performed</strong>: Two main components are needed to perform DNS tunneling: a client and a server. The client sends DNS packets to the internet, encodes content through DNS queries and decodes content from DNS responses. The server receives DNS queries from recursive resolvers, decodes content from DNS queries and encodes content as DNS responses.</p>
<p>Figure 1 illustrates this process at a high level. In this example, the client first encodes a secret value as the subdomain<span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;"> $secret</span> and sends out the DNS query <span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">$secret.badsite[.]com</span>. The resolver then iteratively queries nameservers of different domain levels until it gets a valid response. Figure 1 shows the server receiving and decoding the encoded value <span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">$secret</span>. Optionally, the server component (domain nameservers) encodes a malicious payload as the subdomain <span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">$payload</span> and sends out the DNS response: <span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">$secret.badsite[.]com</span> CNAME <span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">$payload.bs[.]com</span>.</p>
<p>The client component receives and decodes the encoded message <span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">$payload</span>. If the secret value or the malicious payload exceeds the size of a single DNS packet, the client and server break them down and send them as multiple queries and responses.</p>
<figure id="attachment_130581" aria-describedby="caption-attachment-130581" style="width: 900px" class="wp-caption aligncenter"><img decoding="async" class="wp-image-130581" src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/10/word-image-130578-1.png" alt="Image 1 is a diagram of DNS tunneling queries and responses. From the client system, the bad site and the payload of the bad site travel to the DNS resolver. From there the queries and responses are exchanged between the DNS resolver and the root nameservers, TLD nameservers, and the domain nameservers. " width="900" height="381" /><figcaption id="caption-attachment-130581" class="wp-caption-text">Figure 1. An illustrative example of DNS tunneling queries and responses.</figcaption></figure>
<p>Instead of sending raw data, an encoding algorithm is often used to encode and fragment the data. Virtually anyone can come up with an algorithm to perform the fragmentation.</p>
<p>Meanwhile, there are ready-to-use DNS tunneling tools, including open-source applications such as iodine, DNSStager, dnscat2 and sliver, as well as proprietary ones such as <a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/cobalt-strike-team-server/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Cobalt Strike</a>. These tools support encoding generic messages as subdomains of DNS queries and as various types of DNS responses, such as A (IPv4 address), AAAA (IPv6 address), TXT, CNAME and MX. Please see our previous post for a <a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/dns-tunneling-how-dns-can-be-abused-by-malicious-actors/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">more detailed description of DNS tunneling</a>.</p>
<h2><a id="post-130578-_50343o6a6han"></a>Case Studies</h2>
<p>The Palo Alto Networks DNS Security service has supported detecting DNS tunneling traffic since 2019. DNS tunneling detection uses machine learning to analyze the behavioral qualities of DNS queries, DNS responses and how domains are hosted.</p>
<p>We have accumulated four years of data in our efforts to detect in-the-wild DNS tunneling traffic. Our previous research shows that malware campaigns like <a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/solarstorm-supply-chain-attack-timeline/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">SUNBURST</a>, <a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/dns-tunneling-in-the-wild-overview-of-oilrigs-dns-tunneling/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">OilRig</a>, <a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/xhunt-campaign-backdoors/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">xHunt</a> and <a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/darkhydrus-delivers-new-trojan-that-can-use-google-drive-for-c2-communications/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">DarkHydrus</a> have used DNS tunneling for C2 communications.</p>
<p>Our data also reveals other uses for DNS tunneling. To circumvent censorship measures in an enterprise environment, employees have employed virtual private network (VPN) services that utilize DNS tunneling techniques.</p>
<p>Individuals have also used DNS tunneling to bypass charges by internet providers for commercial transportation services like airplanes or cruise ships. Our research indicates that different tunneling domains share characteristics that can reveal the tools used to embed data onto DNS queries and responses and the associated malware campaign name.</p>
<p>Note that people can also use DNS tunneling for legitimate purposes – such as security monitoring. Cybersecurity vendors can leverage the permissive policies of DNS traffic and use DNS tunneling techniques to build easy-to-deploy communication channels. We can use these communication channels to perform real-time checks for files and domains, as well as monitoring honeypots residing in internal networks.</p>
<p>The following anonymized record is an example of such communications:</p><!-- Crayon Syntax Highlighter v_2.7.2_beta -->

		<div id="crayon-6719b4b0a4046339733502" class="crayon-syntax crayon-theme-classic crayon-font-monaco crayon-os-pc print-yes notranslate" data-settings=" minimize scroll-mouseover wrap" style=" margin-top: 12px; margin-bottom: 12px; font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important;">
		
			<div class="crayon-toolbar" data-settings=" mouseover overlay hide delay" style="font-size: 12px !important;height: 18px !important; line-height: 18px !important;"><span class="crayon-title"></span>
			<div class="crayon-tools" style="font-size: 12px !important;height: 18px !important; line-height: 18px !important;"><div class="crayon-button crayon-nums-button" title="Toggle Line Numbers"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-plain-button" title="Toggle Plain Code"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-wrap-button" title="Toggle Line Wrap"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-expand-button" title="Expand Code"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-copy-button" title="Copy"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-popup-button" title="Open Code In New Window"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div></div></div>
			<div class="crayon-info" style="min-height: 16.8px !important; line-height: 16.8px !important;"></div>
			<div class="crayon-plain-wrap"><textarea  class="crayon-plain print-no" data-settings="dblclick" readonly style="-moz-tab-size:4; -o-tab-size:4; -webkit-tab-size:4; tab-size:4; font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important;">
gqwtqmzxhaydimbvgyys2mrnmq6t2pj5.ovqs45lemuxhiy3bfz2gk3ttnrxw62ddomyt2pj5.con[...]per.io TXT "bsu1oaukzzdbehhbsrhaoebqsxvhrdukqavfrfafhbqlncvvdcs15hwawuebfccwuys0npurcnhbtox0wvfv0sfbtcauzpdbuqabdkehjm"</textarea></div>
			<div class="crayon-main" style="">
				<table class="crayon-table">
					<tr class="crayon-row">
				<td class="crayon-nums " data-settings="show">
					<div class="crayon-nums-content" style="font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important;"><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-6719b4b0a4046339733502-1">1</div></div>
				</td>
						<td class="crayon-code"><div class="crayon-pre" style="font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important; -moz-tab-size:4; -o-tab-size:4; -webkit-tab-size:4; tab-size:4;"><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-6719b4b0a4046339733502-1"><span class="crayon-i">gqwtqmzxhaydimbvgyys2mrnmq6t2pj5</span><span class="crayon-sy">.</span><span class="crayon-i">ovqs45lemuxhiy3bfz2gk3ttnrxw62ddomyt2pj5</span><span class="crayon-sy">.</span><span class="crayon-i">con</span><span class="crayon-sy">[</span><span class="crayon-sy">.</span><span class="crayon-sy">.</span><span class="crayon-sy">.</span><span class="crayon-sy">]</span><span class="crayon-i">per</span><span class="crayon-sy">.</span><span class="crayon-e">io </span><span class="crayon-i">TXT</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-s">"bsu1oaukzzdbehhbsrhaoebqsxvhrdukqavfrfafhbqlncvvdcs15hwawuebfccwuys0npurcnhbtox0wvfv0sfbtcauzpdbuqabdkehjm"</span></div></div></td>
					</tr>
				</table>
			</div>
		</div>
<!-- [Format Time: 0.0001 seconds] -->
<p>Because enterprises usually approve such use cases, and because they can be identified and allowed on a per-case basis, we will not discuss them in detail. Meanwhile, it’s important to note that we obtained all the DNS queries and responses described in this article from third-party, passive DNS rather than from customers.</p>
<h3><a id="post-130578-_4rijtbpohpyr"></a><strong>DNS Tunneling as C2</strong></h3>
<p>C2 is the most well-known use case for DNS tunneling. The same campaign can share characteristics such as common nameservers as C2 for communication or a common tunneling tool for encoding and decoding. We introduce examples from three campaigns: two we have identified, and one identified by the community.</p>
<p>Our first example is a campaign that has targeted one of our customers from the financial industry. We observed communications between 22 tunneling domains and the same customer.</p>
<p>These domains share seven nameserver IPs and use the same underlying encoding tool. The attackers also used domain names that imitate popular security or cloud vendors, hoping to evade detection.</p>
<p>A subset of these domains are as follows:</p>
<ul>
<li><span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">panos[.]ltd</span></li>
<li><span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">ciscocloud[.]space</span></li>
<li><span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">ubrella[.]online</span></li>
<li><span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">msft[.]center</span></li>
<li><span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">mscd[.]store</span></li>
<li><span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">awsl[.]site</span></li>
</ul>
<p>We list these domains together with their sample queries, nameserver domains and nameserver IPs in Table 1. Since this campaign targets a customer from the financial industry and uses the same underlying encoding tool that uses queries starting with a counter, we named this campaign <strong>FinCounter</strong>.</p>
<table style="width: 100%;">
<tbody>
<tr>
<td style="width: 25%; text-align: center;"><strong>Domain</strong></td>
<td style="width: 25%; text-align: center;"><strong>Sample Query</strong></td>
<td style="width: 25%; text-align: center;"><strong>Nameserver Domain</strong></td>
<td style="width: 25%; text-align: center;"><strong>Nameserver IP</strong></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="width: 25%;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">panos[.]ltd</span></td>
<td style="width: 25%;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">10.eff89fcf44a13186ad3765f35860ce19c722c4bcda6bbbae6b7bab6025b36d0.d036b5a3fd8b67e55ee35feff7d014fdb8d32afe93d5d6f05f1dda3a096e8fa.2e10d53e935549b3a081982724c3e6f806.oak.panos[.]ltd</span></td>
<td style="width: 25%;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">bur.panos[.]ltd</span></td>
<td style="width: 25%;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">34.92.43[.]140</span></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="width: 25%;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">ciscocloud[.]space</span></td>
<td style="width: 25%;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">10.a6674ae5d37cab7263074adef14925ef28698896b8491276097a470beca325a.669f12d4b31e9a6707ce2ee5b595cb723f40ea6d8e5f406b8fba874c8bec632.3299de58f43c3e4be80a7d7db2a2ed5aee9e13bac9cb.habit.ciscocloud[.]space</span></td>
<td style="width: 25%;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">bram.ciscocloud[.]space</span></td>
<td style="width: 25%;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">34.92.43[.]140</span></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="width: 25%;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">ubrella[.]online</span></td>
<td style="width: 25%;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">8.d4fee8aa63e4ee6435452f86e84464168e96e314eb1a19c45e0e76f3ca71b2a.e9476062765ba0aeaeea97333805f09470ff3bd103e3ce8bd3ffefa3dfea90f.369cd352a204e9662db180407f1d1b8fa87be97c81d1.feign.ubrella[.]online</span></td>
<td style="width: 25%;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">rumor.ubrella[.]online</span></td>
<td style="width: 25%;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">34.92.43[.]140</span></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="width: 25%;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">mscd[.]store</span></td>
<td style="width: 25%;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">4.a6gpmbnqbjewgwnqnlivwhleux4vnnyiuduyqgjkyn9jcihsttpdbdenf7lx8jx.jqhdulrejthsyipzvoleyvhv5s99nydtj5um8bzdmdms9gwdqnq46yis5hvbryo.dernuvjw7a6p6ndq4c8lwomsl7zq5lncgsutndxfpaufefhr7xxeuhfpk8hs.sny7htmpdpqdcumtgrmeptytbe9p78skry64.17328.fish.mscd[.]store</span></td>
<td style="width: 25%;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">rug.mscd[.]store</span></td>
<td style="width: 25%;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">35.194.255[.]111</span></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="width: 25%;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">awsl[.]site</span></td>
<td style="width: 25%;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">1.758fcd0ac2301084ef82efb047050ff5e7d45b4cd636b46e4292b67acac5ab0.a1644dfde400b8d41e7b6ec37338c45d34a8e9ed81173e8dffdf57ebb3c9e30.9fc12877d608dfca610d50a121acbd30b2450391c13a.mud.awsl[.]site</span></td>
<td style="width: 25%;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">lkas.awsl[.]site</span></td>
<td style="width: 25%;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">35.194.255[.]111</span></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="width: 25%;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">msft[.]center</span></td>
<td style="width: 25%;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">10.c5f310abb43603a3af324ee92bea16c8132ec2909fbca8d1036fe409d33af9b.c8c30e936bffb9f93bcba2c27682dcca1ab79aced6d1cf015a11d56a9c2f9f5.c49d8757a19b693d78d1772977cbf164e2748b57bb9f.ud.msft[.]center</span></td>
<td style="width: 25%;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">08e099da.msft[.]center</span></td>
<td style="width: 25%;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">34.81.65[.]4</span></td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<p style="text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 8pt; color: #999999;"><em>Table 1. A subset of the domains used in the FinCounter campaign.</em></span></p>
<p>Our second example is a campaign targeting another financial industry customer. We have observed three tunneling domains targeting the same customer and using the same underlying tunneling-capable tool, Cobalt Strike. Representative characteristics of Cobalt Strike include using common prefixes such as www, post and api.</p>
<p>We have listed the three domains, <span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">identity-mgmt[.]com</span>, <span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">internalsupport[.]info</span>, <span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">cloud-enrollment[.]com</span>, along with sample queries, nameserver domains and IPs in Table 2. Since the attackers try to evade detection by adopting domain names that look like supporting services, we named this campaign <strong>FinSupport</strong>.</p>
<table style="width: 100%; height: 96px;">
<tbody>
<tr style="height: 24px;">
<td style="text-align: center; height: 24px;"><strong>Domain</strong></td>
<td style="text-align: center; height: 24px;"><strong>Sample Query</strong></td>
<td style="text-align: center; height: 24px;"><strong>Nameserver Domain</strong></td>
<td style="text-align: center; height: 24px;"><strong>Nameserver IP</strong></td>
</tr>
<tr style="height: 24px;">
<td style="height: 24px;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">cloud-enrollment[.]com</span></td>
<td style="height: 24px;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">api.12abc2cb5.446f35fa.dns.cloud-enrollment[.]com</span></td>
<td style="height: 24px;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">ns1.cloud-enrollment[.]com</span></td>
<td style="height: 24px;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">3.238.113[.]212</span></td>
</tr>
<tr style="height: 24px;">
<td style="height: 24px;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">identity-mgmt[.]com</span></td>
<td style="height: 24px;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">intact.md.180.02d8f18d2.7e8986be.int.identity-mgmt[.]com</span></td>
<td style="height: 24px;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">ns1.cloud-enrollment[.]com</span></td>
<td style="height: 24px;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">3.238.113[.]212</span></td>
</tr>
<tr style="height: 24px;">
<td style="height: 24px;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">internalsupport[.]info</span></td>
<td style="height: 24px;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">icr.0325e18d8.16ae9fb2.pl.internalsupport[.]info</span></td>
<td style="height: 24px;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">dn.internalsupport[.]info</span></td>
<td style="height: 24px;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">3.238.244[.]129</span></td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<p style="text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 8pt; color: #999999;"><em>Table 2. The list of the domains used in the FinSupport campaign.</em></span></p>
<p>Our third example is the <a href="https://blogs.infoblox.com/cyber-threat-intelligence/cyber-threat-advisory/dog-hunt-finding-decoy-dog-toolkit-via-anomalous-dns-traffic/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Decoy Dog campaign</a>, which was reported by Infoblox in April 2023. We have detected tunneling activities using the same publicly reported domains, including the following:</p>
<ul>
<li><span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">claudfront[.]net</span></li>
<li><span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">allowlisted[.]net</span></li>
<li><span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">hsdps[.]cc</span></li>
</ul>
<p>These Decoy Dog domains share the same underlying tunneling tool Pupy, which uses the character <span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">9</span> as padding when encoding data. Table 3 provides a subset of the domains used by the Decoy Dog campaign, along with sample queries, nameserver domains and nameserver IPs.</p>
<table style="width: 100%; height: 223px;">
<tbody>
<tr style="height: 24px;">
<td style="height: 24px; text-align: center; width: 13.981%;"><strong>Domain</strong></td>
<td style="height: 24px; text-align: center; width: 56.3981%;"><strong>Sample Query</strong></td>
<td style="height: 24px; text-align: center; width: 16.5877%;"><strong>Nameserver Domain</strong></td>
<td style="height: 24px; text-align: center; width: 12.0063%;"><strong>Nameserver IP</strong></td>
</tr>
<tr style="height: 51px;">
<td style="height: 51px; width: 13.981%;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">claudfront[.]net</span></td>
<td style="height: 51px; width: 56.3981%;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">fstz1yibfqnaw6mxpen3nknghh2q9999.1112umplhvbbzf2udr2rpuq9.claudfront[.]net</span></td>
<td style="height: 51px; width: 16.5877%;"><span style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">ns1.claudfront[.]net</span>, <span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">ns2.claudfront[.]net</span></span></td>
<td style="height: 51px; width: 12.0063%;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">5.252.176[.]63</span></td>
</tr>
<tr style="height: 97px;">
<td style="height: 97px; width: 13.981%;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">allowlisted[.]net</span></td>
<td style="height: 97px; width: 56.3981%;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">hs1t4lt2lb2ispy5ho4vmr5okvua9999.111b52v2e3ktuuyrn6j4xrq9.allowlisted[.]net</span></td>
<td style="height: 97px; width: 16.5877%;"><span style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">ns1.allowlisted[.]net</span>, <span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">ns2.allowlisted[.]net</span></span></td>
<td style="height: 97px; width: 12.0063%;"><span style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">83.166.240[.]52</span>,</span></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">5.252.176[.]22</span></td>
</tr>
<tr style="height: 51px;">
<td style="height: 51px; width: 13.981%;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">hsdps[.]cc</span></td>
<td style="height: 51px; width: 56.3981%;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">gc2qagfacoq1zutfr61dko5mdjqa9999.1111suhsamuohkj4o4wn5qa9.hsdps[.]cc</span></td>
<td style="height: 51px; width: 16.5877%;"><span style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">ns1.hsdps.ns1[.]name</span>, <span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">ns2.hsdps.ns1[.]name</span></span></td>
<td style="height: 51px; width: 12.0063%;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">194.31.55[.]85</span></td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<p style="text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 8pt; color: #999999;"><em>Table 3. A subset of the domains used in the Decoy Dog campaign.</em></span></p>
<h3><a id="post-130578-_yezo3d6nu4ki"></a><strong>DNS Tunneling as VPN Service</strong></h3>
<p>VPN service is a previously under-studied use case for DNS tunneling. Some VPN services utilize DNS tunneling to bypass firewall restrictions against VPNs in an enterprise environment. This type of DNS tunneling can also help users bypass service charges for internet access provided by commercial transportation services like airlines, buses or cruise ships.</p>
<p>These types of VPN services share characteristics with DNS tunneling for malicious C2 communications. These characteristics include a common nameserver for communication, or a common tunneling tool for encoding and decoding. To illustrate this, let's examine two popular VPN services and one tunneling tool adopted by multiple VPN services.</p>
<p><a href="https://www.astrill.com/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Astrill VPN</a> is a popular VPN service that tunnels traffic using IPv6 (AAAA) queries and responses, and it uses a corpus of 49 tunneling domains to avoid being blocked. These domains are registered under different TLDs, including the following</p>
<ul>
<li><span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">.com</span></li>
<li><span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">.net</span></li>
<li><span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">.pw</span></li>
<li><span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">.tech</span></li>
<li><span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">.top</span></li>
<li><span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">.space</span></li>
</ul>
<p>Still, they all share the same nameserver IP addresses: <span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">209.133.209[.]197</span> and <span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">104.156.49[.]110</span>. These are also pointed to by <span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">in01.astrill[.]com</span> and <span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">in02.astrill[.]com</span>, the official nameservers for Astrill VPN.</p>
<p>We have listed a subset of the domains used by Astrill VPN in Table 4, along with sample records, nameserver domains and nameserver IPs. The sample record is different from the sample query. A sample query only contains one field (i.e., the query), whereas a sample record contains three fields (the query, the response type and the response).</p>
<p>We frequently observe tunneling traffic from Astrill VPN in customers’ networks, indicating its wide adoption and potential abuse by employees to bypass corporate firewall restrictions on using VPN services. However, the real intentions of users can vary from unawareness of the underlying technology to active adoption of a DNS tunneling-based VPN service. An IT department can only identify and handle this on a per-case basis.</p>
<table style="width: 100%; height: 177px;">
<tbody>
<tr style="height: 24px;">
<td style="text-align: center; width: 15.5316%; height: 24px;"><strong>Domain</strong></td>
<td style="text-align: center; width: 49.5016%; height: 24px;"><strong>Sample Record</strong></td>
<td style="text-align: center; width: 19.5183%; height: 24px;"><strong>Nameserver Domain</strong></td>
<td style="text-align: center; width: 14.4518%; height: 24px;"><strong>Nameserver IP</strong></td>
</tr>
<tr style="height: 51px;">
<td style="width: 15.5316%; height: 51px;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">nanogardens[.]tech</span></td>
<td style="width: 49.5016%; height: 51px;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">0g87sbvrbb8f79ee.s2bbv747ck53wp7k.s.nanogardens[.]tech AAAA 1327:fb85:793c:bda6:d571:841f:b240[:]1cb2</span></td>
<td style="width: 19.5183%; height: 51px;"><span style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">s01.nanogardens[.]tech</span>, <span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">s02.nanogardens[.]tech</span></span></td>
<td style="width: 14.4518%; height: 51px;"><span style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">209.133.209[.]197</span>, <span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">104.156.49[.]110</span></span></td>
</tr>
<tr style="height: 51px;">
<td style="width: 15.5316%; height: 51px;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">openair[.]pw</span></td>
<td style="width: 49.5016%; height: 51px;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">nq482xfw1zyq0vg5.ehadgy6qeq015w47.s.openair[.]pw AAAA aca9:8998:5018:1b61:fa26:b64f:77fb[:]a325</span></td>
<td style="width: 19.5183%; height: 51px;"><span style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">s01.openair[.]pw</span>, <span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">s02.openair[.]pw</span></span></td>
<td style="width: 14.4518%; height: 51px;"><span style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">209.133.209[.]197</span>, <span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">104.156.49[.]110</span></span></td>
</tr>
<tr style="height: 51px;">
<td style="width: 15.5316%; height: 51px;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">radiantsands[.]com</span></td>
<td style="width: 49.5016%; height: 51px;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">nq482xfw1zyq0vg5.ehadgy6qeq015w47.s.radiantsands[.]com AAAA a646:622:d647:539b:a780:21c9:eabe[:]1162</span></td>
<td style="width: 19.5183%; height: 51px;"><span style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">s01.radiantsands[.]com</span>, <span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">s02.radiantsands[.]com</span></span></td>
<td style="width: 14.4518%; height: 51px;"><span style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">209.133.209[.]197</span>, <span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">104.156.49[.]110</span></span></td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<p style="text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 8pt; color: #999999;"><em>Table 4. A subset of the domains used by Astrill VPN.</em></span></p>
<p>Similarly, <a href="https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.hatunnel.plus" target="_blank" rel="noopener">HA Tunnel Plus</a> is a popular VPN service that tunnels traffic using TXT queries and responses, and it uses only one tunneling domain (<span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">hat53[.]com</span>). We frequently observe tunneling traffic under this domain from customers’ networks, including cruise lines, which indicates that passengers use VPN services to bypass network service charges.</p>
<p>The following is a sample TXT tunneling record:</p><!-- Crayon Syntax Highlighter v_2.7.2_beta -->

		<div id="crayon-6719b4b0a4051775533891" class="crayon-syntax crayon-theme-classic crayon-font-monaco crayon-os-pc print-yes notranslate" data-settings=" minimize scroll-mouseover wrap" style=" margin-top: 12px; margin-bottom: 12px; font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important;">
		
			<div class="crayon-toolbar" data-settings=" mouseover overlay hide delay" style="font-size: 12px !important;height: 18px !important; line-height: 18px !important;"><span class="crayon-title"></span>
			<div class="crayon-tools" style="font-size: 12px !important;height: 18px !important; line-height: 18px !important;"><div class="crayon-button crayon-nums-button" title="Toggle Line Numbers"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-plain-button" title="Toggle Plain Code"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-wrap-button" title="Toggle Line Wrap"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-expand-button" title="Expand Code"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-copy-button" title="Copy"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-popup-button" title="Open Code In New Window"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div></div></div>

					<div class="crayon-nums-content" style="font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important;"><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-6719b4b0a4051775533891-1">1</div></div>
				</td>
						<td class="crayon-code"><div class="crayon-pre" style="font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important; -moz-tab-size:4; -o-tab-size:4; -webkit-tab-size:4; tab-size:4;"><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-6719b4b0a4051775533891-1"><span class="crayon-i">t3f43builrjoxy5olfgijiryoi3vcabaabtq4byag2cqaad3emaaa3aaaaacsnn</span><span class="crayon-sy">.</span><span class="crayon-cn">5rhm62glydte5esgax5p57dwyygwfnszyvpc4s2euahvqeceqb6crq64lbq5fr6.4lwcok3fmou2bobxyv2v27u67oez35kt5suc7eek26ykoob32vizswowherp2vj.bv2cnzu3luktz7aplh2whj63kmd2tb5kse4rky3ag4r.ns</span>-<span class="crayon-i">ca1</span><span class="crayon-sy">.</span><span class="crayon-i">hat53</span><span class="crayon-sy">[</span><span class="crayon-sy">.</span><span class="crayon-sy">]</span><span class="crayon-e">com </span><span class="crayon-i">TXT</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-sy">\</span><span class="crayon-sy">\</span><span class="crayon-cn">000</span><span class="crayon-sy">\</span><span class="crayon-sy">\</span><span class="crayon-cn">024</span><span class="crayon-sy">\</span><span class="crayon-sy">\</span><span class="crayon-cn">1628r7r</span><span class="crayon-sy">\</span><span class="crayon-sy">\</span><span class="crayon-cn">000</span><span class="crayon-sy">@</span><span class="crayon-sy">\</span><span class="crayon-sy">\</span><span class="crayon-cn">000</span><span class="crayon-sy">\</span><span class="crayon-sy">\</span><span class="crayon-cn">140</span><span class="crayon-sy">\</span><span class="crayon-sy">\</span><span class="crayon-cn">014</span><span class="crayon-sy">\</span><span class="crayon-sy">\</span><span class="crayon-cn">007</span><span class="crayon-sy">\</span><span class="crayon-sy">\</span><span class="crayon-cn">0009</span><span class="crayon-sy">\</span><span class="crayon-sy">\</span><span class="crayon-cn">133</span><span class="crayon-sy">\</span><span class="crayon-sy">\</span><span class="crayon-cn">000</span><span class="crayon-sy">\</span><span class="crayon-sy">\</span><span class="crayon-cn">000u</span><span class="crayon-sy">\</span><span class="crayon-sy">\</span><span class="crayon-cn">133</span><span class="crayon-sy">\</span><span class="crayon-sy">\</span><span class="crayon-cn">000</span><span class="crayon-sy">\</span><span class="crayon-sy">\</span><span class="crayon-cn">000</span><span class="crayon-sy">\</span><span class="crayon-sy">\</span><span class="crayon-cn">000</span><span class="crayon-sy">\</span><span class="crayon-sy">\</span><span class="crayon-cn">000</span><span class="crayon-sy">\</span><span class="crayon-sy">\</span><span class="crayon-cn">000</span><span class="crayon-sy">\</span><span class="crayon-sy">\</span><span class="crayon-cn">000</span></div></div></td>
					</tr>
				</table>
			</div>
		</div>
<!-- [Format Time: 0.0002 seconds] -->
<p>To optimize its performance, HA Tunnel Plus uses multiple nameservers to serve tunneling traffic from different regions. For example, tunneling queries that are subdomains of <span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">ns-ca1.hat53[.]com</span> are redirected to a Canadian nameserver <span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">a-ca1.hat53[.]com</span> with IP <span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">138.197.156[.]58</span>. Tunneling queries that are subdomains of <span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">ns-de1.hat53[.]com</span> are redirected to a German nameserver <span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">a-de1.hat53[.]com</span> with IP <span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">104.248.27[.]88</span>.</p>
<p>We list more service countries in Table 5.</p>
<table style="width: 100%;">
<tbody>
<tr>
<td style="text-align: center;"><strong>Service Country</strong></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><strong>Subdomain</strong></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><strong>Nameserver Domain</strong></td>
<td style="text-align: center;"><strong>Nameserver IP</strong></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><span style="font-weight: 400;">Canada</span></td>
<td><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">ns-ca1.hat53[.]com</span></td>
<td><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">a-ca1.hat53[.]com</span></td>
<td><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">138.197.156[.]58</span></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><span style="font-weight: 400;">Germany</span></td>
<td><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">ns-de1.hat53[.]com</span></td>
<td><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">a-de1.hat53[.]com</span></td>
<td><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">104.248.27[.]88</span></td>
</tr>

<td><span style="font-weight: 400;">Singapore</span></td>
<td><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">ns-sg1.hat53[.]com</span></td>
<td><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">a-sg1.hat53[.]com</span></td>
<td><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">159.223.37[.]124</span></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><span style="font-weight: 400;">United States</span></td>
<td><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">ns-us1.hat53[.]com</span></td>
<td><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">a-us1.hat53[.]com</span></td>
<td><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">147.182.186[.]204</span></td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<p style="text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 8pt; color: #999999;"><em>Table 5. A subset of the service countries of HA Tunnel Plus.</em></span></p>
<p>While VPN services can be individually identified and verified, different services can use the same underlying tunneling encoding and decoding tool. An example is <a href="https://www.bamsoftware.com/software/dnstt/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">dnstt</a>, an open-source DNS tunneling tool used by several VPN services, such as the following:</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=vpn.minapronet.com.eg" target="_blank" rel="noopener">MinaProNet VPN</a></li>
<li><a href="https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=net.androidtechvilla.edoztunnel" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Edoztunnel VPN</a></li>
<li><a href="https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.tunnelcatvpn.android" target="_blank" rel="noopener">TunnelCat VPN</a></li>
</ul>
<p>Dnstt implements a protocol on top of DNS queries and responses, and it has security features such as encryption and authentication. Dnstt uses <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/TXT_record" target="_blank" rel="noopener">TXT record</a> exclusively to encode data into DNS responses. In addition to the standard UDP, dnstt can also use DoH (DNS-over-HTTPS) and DoT (DNS-over-TLS) to provide privacy and evade detection.</p>
<p>Note that DNS Security Service can identify DoH and DoT resolvers and use the <a href="https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/pan-os/9-1/pan-os-admin/decryption/decryption-overview" target="_blank" rel="noopener">decryption feature</a> to decrypt the payloads, allowing DNS tunneling detection to work seamlessly.</p>
<p>Table 6 includes example VPN services using the dnstt tool and their sample domain setups. Similar to HA Tunnel Plus, the listed services use multiple nameservers to serve tunneling traffic from different regions to optimize performance.</p>
<table style="width: 100%; height: 261px;">
<tbody>
<tr style="height: 48px;">
<td style="text-align: center; height: 48px; width: 19.5655%;"><strong>VPN Service</strong></td>
<td style="text-align: center; height: 48px; width: 18.496%;"><strong>Sample Domain</strong></td>
<td style="text-align: center; height: 48px; width: 20.9024%;"><strong>Sample Record</strong></td>
<td style="text-align: center; height: 48px; width: 20.3008%;"><strong>Nameserver Domains</strong></td>
<td style="text-align: center; height: 48px; width: 20.7353%;"><strong>Nameserver IPs</strong></td>
</tr>
<tr style="height: 51px;">
<td style="height: 102px; width: 19.5655%;" rowspan="2"><span style="font-weight: 400;">MinaProNet VPN</span></td>
<td style="height: 102px; width: 18.496%;" rowspan="2"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">minapronetvpn[.]com</span></td>
<td style="height: 51px; width: 20.9024%;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">6rpaviehgxyvpyy4ocbbxkiyv2zvcacaad4iw3qaxa3acahhuyaaaayaaaabo3z.2.dnstt-server.minapronetvpn[.]com TXT \\000\\024\\169\\024\\174\\179r\\000@\\000\\248\\139n\\000\\1866\\001\\000\\1846\\001\\000\\000\\000\\000\\000 </span></td>

<td style="height: 51px; width: 20.9024%;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">khvsoyur5pwo5yyz6wzeikuydeivcacaabgxiaaa74bqaad4amaaalaaaaagi4s.idfsuez5dmik2iuoywuf57fozubc2vw2e7jd4ioufzyvaumnhuceo5gznotvueq.ez4u.newca.dozapp[.]xyz TXT \\000\\024*\\152\\025\\017r\\000@\\000dt\\000\\000\\251\\003\\000\\000\\253\\003\\000\\000\\000\\000\\000\\000</span></td>

<td style="height: 25px; width: 20.7353%;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">3.67.83[.]152</span></td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<p style="text-align: center;"><span style="font-size: 8pt; color: #999999;"><em>Table 6. Example VPN services using the dnstt tool.</em></span></p>
<h2><a id="post-130578-_ukww5vzhpd66"></a>Attribution of Tools and Campaigns</h2>
<p>Since various tools use tunneling domains for different purposes, IT departments need more information on these domains to decide if they need to block them. For example, if an IT department encounters tunneling traffic from TunnelCat VPN in its enterprise network, this could be caused by an employee trying to circumvent firewall restrictions. They can warn the employee, or leadership can reinforce the organization's policy on best security practices.</p>
<p>If the VPN traffic is found within a cruise ship’s network, this is potentially because a passenger is trying to bypass service access charges, and the traffic should be blocked. However, if tunneling traffic matches the FinCounter campaign, enterprise IT departments can choose to isolate the compromised hosts and conduct a thorough investigation to understand the impact of the attack.</p>
<p>Tunneling traffic toward VPN services and C2 domains is different not only because of the implied intentions, but also because of the implied capabilities. First, VPN services require users to install an app that is vetted by marketplace maintainers, and which will authenticate that they’re using the right VPN server. While it’s possible to proxy malicious traffic through VPN servers, it does incur a higher engineering and financial overhead. Second, C2 domains don’t have such overhead and are highly customizable.</p>
<p>To this end, based on our insights into tunneling domains, we have implemented an attribution system that analyzes tunneling domains in real time to detect corresponding tools and campaigns.</p>
<p>The key idea is to extract characteristics unique to different tools and campaigns from tunneling domains including the following:</p>
<ul>
<li>How tunneling domains are hosted</li>
<li>How data is encoded into queries and responses</li>
<li>How and when data is transmitted</li>
<li>Auxiliary information, such as who is being targeted and third-party verdicts about these domains</li>
</ul>
<p>We have created a labeled dataset containing over 50 tunneling tools and campaigns and over 1,000 tunneling domains. Our system compares newly detected tunneling domains against the labeled ones using the aforementioned characteristics to automatically predict if a newly encountered domain belongs to an existing campaign or uses a known tunneling tool.</p>
<p>Table 7 lists examples of attributed tunneling tools and campaigns by the system. <span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">Rcsmf100[.]net</span> is attributed to the Decoy Dog campaign mainly because it uses the same nameserver IP <span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">83.166.240[.]52</span> as the domain <span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">allowlisted[.]net</span>. On the other hand, <span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">hammercdntech[.]com</span> and <span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">todoreal[.]cf</span> are attributed to Cobalt Strike and dnstt respectively, because they reused the encoding tool.</p>
<table style="width: 100%;">
<tbody>
<tr>
<td style="text-align: center; width: 22.2573%;"><strong>Domain</strong></td>
<td style="text-align: center; width: 27.7427%;"><strong>Sample Query</strong></td>
<td style="width: 19.3905%; text-align: center;"><strong>Nameserver Domain</strong></td>
<td style="width: 19.9565%; text-align: center;"><strong>Nameserver IP</strong></td>
<td style="width: 20.653%; text-align: center;"><strong>Attribution</strong></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="width: 22.2573%;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">rcsmf100[.]net</span></td>
<td style="width: 27.7427%;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">tjkrwmhdoj5ctmtatfsvfnnwfeva9999.1125de632ujq9999.rcsmf100[.]net</span></td>
<td style="width: 19.3905%;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">ns1.rcsmf100[.]net, ns2.rcsmf100[.]net</span></td>
<td style="width: 19.9565%;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">83.166.240[.]52</span></td>
<td style="width: 20.653%;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Decoy Dog</span></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="width: 22.2573%;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">hammercdntech[.]com</span></td>
<td style="width: 27.7427%;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">d-1ox.2cd649aed1f5ab311b08dce2066589388e395e9f0c0e85c940b37f209.b24afc9b030682dac90e4f83acc913711b68b056601e00e8778c4040.17f1d6e11.370935f6.ns1.hammercdntech[.]com</span></td>
<td style="width: 19.3905%;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">cdn7ad6a01b.hammercdntech[.]com</span></td>
<td style="width: 19.9565%;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">65.20.73[.]176</span></td>
<td style="width: 20.653%;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Cobalt Strike</span></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="width: 22.2573%;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">todoreal[.]cf</span></td>
<td style="width: 27.7427%;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">bcm74mohxicvfy77u2zte2whzjjveacaadnj5nb6hubaaaceaiaaaaaaaaagvr6.kkniqaqaa2nlqeahpaiaaaracaaaaeaaaaaazy.slowdns.todoreal[.]cf TXT \\000\\024j\\199\\202sr\\000 \\000\\211w\\002\\000\\239\\002\\000\\000d\\004\\000\\000\\000\\000\\000\\000</span></td>
<td style="width: 19.3905%;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">dns.todoreal[.]cf</span></td>
<td style="width: 19.9565%;"><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">172.67.136[.]96</span></td>
<td style="width: 20.653%;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">dnstt</span></td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<p style="text-align: center;"><span style="color: #999999; font-size: 8pt;"><em>Table 7. Examples of attributed tunneling tools and campaigns.</em></span></p>
<h2><a id="post-130578-_2an8ryq91inv"></a>Conclusion</h2>
<p>People are actively using DNS tunneling for various purposes, including well-known C2 servers and less-known VPN services. Detecting and understanding DNS tunneling can help protect Palo Alto Networks customers. Therefore, we have built a real-time attribution system to identify the underlying tools and associated campaigns for tunneling domains to provide more insights, allow fine-grained analysis and fast incident response.</p>
<p>Palo Alto Networks <a href="https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/ngfw" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Next-Generation Firewall</a> customers receive protections against malicious indicators (domain, IP) mentioned in this article via <a href="https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/advanced-url-filtering/administration" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Advanced URL Filtering</a> and our <a href="https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/dns-security" target="_blank" rel="noopener">DNS Security</a> subscription services.</p>
<p>Palo Alto Networks <a href="https://docs-cortex.paloaltonetworks.com/p/XDR" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Cortex XDR</a> analytics customers receive protection against DNS tunneling techniques mentioned in this article via the DNS tunneling analytics detector.</p>
<p>Palo Alto Networks has shared our findings, including file samples and indicators of compromise, with our fellow Cyber Threat Alliance (CTA) members. CTA members use this intelligence to rapidly deploy protections to their customers and to systematically disrupt malicious cyber actors. Learn more about the <a href="https://www.cyberthreatalliance.org/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Cyber Threat Alliance</a>.</p>
<h2><a id="post-130578-_v8176g40kstn"></a>Indicators of Compromise</h2>
<h3><a id="post-130578-_763h15eckspk"></a>Domains</h3>
<ul>
<li><span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">panos[.]ltd</span></li>
<li><span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">ciscocloud[.]space</span></li>
<li><span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">ubrella[.]online</span></li>
<li><span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">mscd[.]store</span></li>
<li><span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">awsl[.]site</span></li>
<li><span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">msft[.]center</span></li>
<li><span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">cloud-enrollment[.]com</span></li>
<li><span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">identity-mgmt[.]com</span></li>
<li><span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">internalsupport[.]info</span></li>
<li><span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">claudfront[.]net</span></li>
<li><span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">allowlisted[.]net</span></li>
<li><span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">hsdps[.]cc</span></li>
<li><span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">rcsmf100[.]net</span></li>
<li><span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">hammercdntech[.]com</span></li>
</ul>

<li><span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">35.194.255[.]111</span></li>
<li><span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">34.81.65[.]4</span></li>
<li><span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">3.238.113[.]212</span></li>
<li><span style="font-family: 'courier new', courier, monospace;">3.238.244[.]129</span></li>

              <div class="card-media " >
                              <figure>
                <img width="786" height="368" src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/08/11_DNS_Overview_1920x900-786x368.jpg" class="attachment-medium size-medium" alt="A pictorial representation of deepfake scams.                             </div>
              <div class="card-content">
                <div class="card-content__wrapper">
                  <a class="card-category" href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/category/threat-research/" role="link" data-page-track="true" data-page-track-value="dns-tunneling-in-the-wild:related-resources:The Emerging Dynamics of Deepfake Scam Campaigns on the Web:Threat Research"><span class=""><img src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/06/icon-threat-research.svg" alt=" category icon">Threat Research</span></a>                  <a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/dynamics-of-deepfake-scams/" data-page-track="true" data-page-track-value="dns-tunneling-in-the-wild:related-resources:The Emerging Dynamics of Deepfake Scam Campaigns on the Web">
                    <h4 class="post-title">The Emerging Dynamics of Deepfake Scam Campaigns on the Web</h4>
                  </a>
                  <ul class="card-tags" role="list">
				<li role="listitem">
					<a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/tag/genai/" title="GenAI" role="link" data-page-track="true" data-page-track-value="dns-tunneling-in-the-wild:related-resources:The Emerging Dynamics of Deepfake Scam Campaigns on the Web:GenAI">GenAI</a>
				</li>
				<li role="listitem">
					<a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/tag/scams/" title="Scams" role="link" data-page-track="true" data-page-track-value="dns-tunneling-in-the-wild:related-resources:The Emerging Dynamics of Deepfake Scam Campaigns on the Web:Scams">Scams</a>
				</li>
				<li role="listitem">
					<a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/tag/phishing/" title="phishing" role="link" data-page-track="true" data-page-track-value="dns-tunneling-in-the-wild:related-resources:The Emerging Dynamics of Deepfake Scam Campaigns on the Web:phishing">Phishing</a>
				</li></ul>                </div>
                <div class="card-content__link">
                                    <a class="hyperlink" href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/dynamics-of-deepfake-scams/" title="The Emerging Dynamics of Deepfake Scam Campaigns on the Web" role="link" data-page-track="true" data-page-track-value="dns-tunneling-in-the-wild:related-resources:The Emerging Dynamics of Deepfake Scam Campaigns on the Web:read now">
                    Read now                    <img src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/themes/unit42-v6/dist/images/icons/icon-right-arrow-withtail.svg" alt="Right arrow">
                  </a>
                </div>
              </div>
            </div>
                                <div class="pa l-card l-card--slider" >
              <div class="card-media " >
                              <figure>
                <img width="786" height="368" src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/08/01_DNS_Overview_1920x900-786x368.jpg" class="attachment-medium size-medium" alt="A pictorial representation of using autoencoders to detect malicious DNS traffic.               <div class="card-content">

        <div class="be-enlarge-modal" id="enlargedModal">
          <div class="be-enlarge-modal__wrapper"> 
            <figure> 
              <button class="close__modal" id="closeModal"> 
              <img src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/themes/unit42-v6/dist/images/icons/close-modal.svg" alt="Close button"></button>
              <img class="be__enlarged-image" id="enlargedImage" src="" alt="Enlarged Image">
              <figcaption> </figcaption>
            </figure>
          </div>
        </div>

      </div>
    </section>
  </main>
<!--  Start: Footer subscription form -->
<div class="newsletter">
      <div class="l-container">
        <div class="newsletter__wrapper">
          <div class="image__wrapper"> 
            <picture>
			              	 <source media="(max-width:400px)" srcset="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/06/newsletter-Image-mobile.webp">
			  			               	 <source media="(max-width:949px)" srcset="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/06/newsletter-Image-tab.webp">
			  			  			  	<img src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/06/Revitalized_newsletter-Image-desktop-copy-1.webp" alt="Newsletter">
			              </picture>
          </div>
          <div class="content__wrapper"> 
		    							<span class="pre-title"> 
				<img src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/themes/unit42-v6/dist/images/palo-alto-logo-small.svg" alt="UNIT 42 Small Logo">
				Get updates from Unit 42			</span>
						           	 <h2>Peace of mind comes from staying ahead of threats. Contact us today.</h2>
			            <form action="https://www.paloaltonetworks.com/apps/pan/public/formsubmithandler.submitform.json" method="post" novalidate class="subscribe-form" name="Unit42_Subscribe" id="unit42footerSubscription_form">
              <input type="hidden" name="emailFormMask" value="">
              <input type="hidden" value="1086" name="formid">
              <input type="hidden" value="531-OCS-018" name="munchkinId">
              <input type="hidden" value="2141" name="lpId">
              <input type="hidden" value="1203" name="programId">
              <input type="hidden" value="1086" name="formVid">
              <input type="hidden" name="mkto_optinunit42" value="true">
              <input type="hidden" name="mkto_opt-in" value="true">
              <div class="form-group"> 
                <label for="newsletter-email"  id="newsletter-email-label">Your Email</label>
                <input type="emal" placeholder="Your Email" name="Email"  class="subscribe-field" id="newsletter-email" aria-labelledby="newsletter-email-label">
                <p class="error-mail mb-15 text-danger" style="color: #dc3545"></p>
				<p>Subscribe for email updates to all Unit 42 threat research.<br />By submitting this form, you agree to our <a title="Terms of Use" href="https://www.paloaltonetworks.com/legal-notices/terms-of-use" data-page-track="true" data-page-track-value="Get updates from Unit 42:Terms of Use">Terms of Use</a> and acknowledge our <a title="Privacy Statement" href="https://www.paloaltonetworks.com/legal-notices/privacy" data-page-track="true" data-page-track-value="Get updates from Unit 42:Privacy Statement">Privacy Statement.</a></p>
                <div class="g-recaptcha" data-expired-callback="captchaExpires" data-callback="captchaComplete" data-sitekey="6Lc5EhgTAAAAAJa-DzE7EeWABasWg4LKv-R3ao6o"></div>
                <p class="error-recaptcha d-none mt-15 text-danger" style="color: #dc3545">Invalid captcha!</p>
                <button class="l-btn is-disabled" data-page-track="true" data-page-track-value="footer:Get updates from Unit 42:Subscribe" id="unit42footerSubscription_form_button"> 
					Subscribe					<img src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/themes/unit42-v6/dist/images/icons/right-arrow.svg" alt="Right Arrow"  class="arrow">
					<img src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/themes/unit42-v6/dist/images/icons/icon-loader.svg" alt="loader" class="loader">
			   </button>
				<div class="form-success-message"></div>
              </div>
            </form>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>

<script>

(function($) {
	// Migrated from the unit42-v5 + Modifications
	var subscribeSuccess = false;
	var email = document.getElementById('newsletter-email');
	var subscription_form = document.getElementById('unit42footerSubscription_form');
	var subscription_form_button = document.getElementById('unit42footerSubscription_form_button');
	window.captchaComplete = function() {
		subscribeSuccess = true;
		if ($(mail).val() != '' && isEmail($(mail).val())) {
			$(subscription_form_button).removeClass('is-disabled');
		}
		setTimeout(function() {
			$(email).focus();
			$('.g-recaptcha iframe').attr('tabindex', '-1');
		}, 100)
	}
	window.captchaExpires = function() {
		subscribeSuccess = false;
		$(subscription_form_button).addClass('is-disabled', true);
	} 
	$(subscription_form).submit(function(e) {
		e.preventDefault();
		e.stopImmediatePropagation();
		updateEmailMask();
		var success = true;
		var form = $(this);
		var mail = form.find('input[name="Email"]');
		
		if (mail.val() === '') {
			mail.addClass('has-error');
			showError(1);
			success = false;	
		}  else if (!isEmail(mail.val())){
			showError(2);
			success = false;
		}
		else {
			mail.removeClass('has-error');
			$('.error-mail').addClass('d-none');
		}

		if (!subscribeSuccess) {
			$('.error-recaptcha').removeClass('d-none');
		} else {
			$('.error-recaptcha').addClass('d-none');
		}

		if (success && subscribeSuccess) {
			$.ajax({
				type: 'POST',
				url: form.attr('action'),
				data: form.serialize(),
				beforeSend: function() {
                 form.find('button').addClass('is-loading');
    			},
				success: function(msg) {
					form.find('.form-success-message').html('<p class="success-message">You have been successfully subscribed</p>');
					form.find('button').removeClass('is-loading');
					$(email).val('');
					clearError();
				},
				error: function(jqXHR, textStatus, errorThrown) {
					$(subscription_form_button).addClass('is-disabled', true);
					form.find('button').removeClass('is-loading');
					
				}
			});
		}
		return false;
	});
	function showError(error_type){
		if(error_type == 1) {
			$('.error-mail').text("Please enter the email address.").addClass('error-show');
			$(subscription_form_button).addClass('is-disabled');
		} else if(error_type == 2){
			$('.error-mail').text("Please provide a valid e-mail address.").addClass('error-show');
			$(subscription_form_button).addClass('is-disabled');
		}	
		$(subscription_form_button).removeClass('is-loading');
	}
	function clearError(){
		$('.error-mail').text("").removeClass('error-show');;
		$(subscription_form_button).removeClass('is-loading');
		$(subscription_form_button).removeClass('is-disabled');
	}
	
	$(email).on('input', function (event) { 
		var email = $(this).val();
		if (isEmail(email) ) {			
			clearError();
		} else if(email == ""){
			clearError();
		} else{
			showError(2);			  
		}
    });

	function isEmail(email) {
		var re = /^(([^<>()\[\]\\.,;:\s@"]+(\.[^<>()\[\]\\.,;:\s@"]+)*)|(".+"))@((\[[0-9]{1,3}\.[0-9]{1,3}\.[0-9]{1,3}\.[0-9]{1,3}\])|(([a-zA-Z\-0-9]+\.)+[a-zA-Z]{2,}))$/;
		return re.test(String(email).toLowerCase());
	}
	
	var captcha_loaded = false;
         if(!captcha_loaded){
            // recaptcha on foucs call
            $(document).on('change paste keyup', '#newsletter-email', function () {
               if($('.g-recaptcha').hasClass('d-none')){
                $('.g-recaptcha').removeClass('d-none');
               }
               if(!captcha_loaded ){
                  captcha_loaded  = true;
                  // trigger loading api.js (recaptcha.js) script
                  var head = document.getElementsByTagName('head')[0];
                  var script = document.createElement('script');
                  script.type = 'text/javascript';
                  script.src = 'https://www.google.com/recaptcha/api.js?hl=en_US';
                  head.appendChild(script);
               }
            });
        }
	
	function updateEmailMask() {
		var email = $("#unit42footerSubscription_form input[name='Email']").val();
		if (email && email.trim() != '') {
			var maskedEmail = maskEmailAddress(email);
			$("#unit42footerSubscription_form input[name='emailFormMask']").val(maskedEmail);
		}
	}

	function maskEmailAddress (emailAddress) {
		function mask(str) {
			var strLen = str.length;
			if (strLen > 4) {
				return str.substr(0, 1) + str.substr(1, strLen - 1).replace(/\w/g, '*') + str.substr(-1,1);
			}
			return str.replace(/\w/g, '*');
		}
		return emailAddress.replace(/([\w.]+)@([\w.]+)(\.[\w.]+)/g, function (m, p1, p2, p3) {
			return mask(p1) + '@' + mask(p2) + p3;
		});

		return emailAddress;
	}

}(jQuery));
//# sourceMappingURL=main.js.map
	
</script>
<!--  End: Footer subscription form -->

        <div class="footer-menu-nav__wrapper">
                      <h3 class="footer-menu-nav__title">Company</h3>
                                <div class="nav-column__wrapper">
          <div class="nav-column">
            													<nav>
					<ul class="footer-menu-nav__list"> 
																	<li class="footer-menu-nav__item "> 
							<a href="https://www.paloaltonetworks.com/about-us"   role="link" title="About Us" data-page-track="true" data-page-track-value="footer:Company:About Us">About Us</a>
						</li>    
																	<li class="footer-menu-nav__item "> 
							<a href="https://jobs.paloaltonetworks.com/en/"   role="link" title="Careers" data-page-track="true" data-page-track-value="footer:Company:About Us:Careers">Careers</a>
						</li>    
																	<li class="footer-menu-nav__item "> 
							<a href="https://www.paloaltonetworks.com/company/contact-sales"   role="link" title="Contact Us" data-page-track="true" data-page-track-value="footer:Company:About Us:Careers:Contact Us">Contact Us</a>
						</li>    
																	<li class="footer-menu-nav__item ">

    <script type="text/javascript">
	var isProcessing = false; 
    function alter_ul_post_values(obj,post_id,ul_type){
	
		if (isProcessing)    
		return;  
		isProcessing = true;   
		var like_nonce = jQuery('#_wpnonce').val();
		jQuery(obj).find("span").html("..");
                jQuery.ajax({
                    type: "POST",
                    url: "https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/plugins/like-dislike-counter-for-posts-pages-and-comments/ajax_counter.php",
                    data: "post_id="+post_id+"&up_type="+ul_type+"&ul_nonce="+like_nonce,
                    success: function(msg){
                            jQuery(obj).find("span").html(msg);
                            isProcessing = false; 
                            jQuery(obj).find('svg').children('path').attr('stroke','#0050FF');
                            jQuery(obj).removeClass('idc_ul_cont_not_liked idc_ul_cont_not_liked_inner');
                    }
 		});
	}
	</script>
    <link rel='stylesheet' id='wpdevart_lightbox_front_end_css-css' href='https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/plugins/lightbox-popup/includes/style/wpdevart_lightbox_front.css?ver=6.6.1' media='all' />
<script src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/themes/unit42-v6/dist/js/script.js?ver=1.0.0" id="unit42-v6-navigation-js"></script>

<!--  Start: Scripts Migrated From Unit42-v5 -->
<script type="text/javascript">
const observer_lozad = lozad('.lozad, .lozad-background'); // lazy loads elements with default selector as '.lozad'
observer_lozad.observe();

window.PAN_Clean_Util = {
        isIE: false
};

(function () {
   // INP Util Fix
    function yieldToMain(ms) {
        return new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, ms));
    }
   window.PAN_Clean_Util.yieldToMain = yieldToMain
})();

if(referer == "Prisma" || referer == "Cortex" || referer == "Sase" || referer == "Unit" || referer == "Ngfw"){
  var Coveo_organizationId = "paloaltonetworksintranet";        
  var techDocsPagePath = "https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/search.html#hd=All%20Prisma%20Cloud%20Documentation&hq=%40panproductcategory%3D%3D(%22Prisma%20Cloud%22)&sort=relevancy&layout=card&numberOfResults=25";
  var languageFromPath="en_US";
  window.Granite = window.Granite || {};
  Granite.I18n = (function() {
  var self = {};
  self.setLocale = function(locale) { };
  self.get = function(text, snippets, note) {
    var out = "";
    if(text){
      if(text ==="coveo.clear"){
        out = "Clear";
      }else if(text ==="coveo.noresultsfound"){
        out = "No results found for this search term.";
      }
    }
    return out;
  };
  return self
  }());
}

  var main_site_critical_top = maindomain_lang+'/etc.clientlibs/panClean/components/mainNavigationComp/clientlibs/panClean/criticalTop.min.js';
  var main_site_defered = maindomain_lang+'/etc.clientlibs/panClean/components/mainNavigationComp/clientlibs/panClean/defered.min.js';
  var main_site_criticalTopBase = maindomain_lang+'/etc.clientlibs/panClean/components/mainNavigationComp/clientlibs/panClean/criticalTopBase.min.js';
  var main_site_criticalTopProductNav = maindomain_lang+'/etc.clientlibs/panClean/components/mainNavigationComp/clientlibs/panClean/criticalTopProductNav.min.js';
window.PAN_MainNavAsyncUrl = maindomain_lang+"/_jcr_content/globals/cleanHeaderPrisma.prismaRenderer.html";

function loadScript(url, defer){
    var script1 = document.createElement('script');
    script1.setAttribute('type', 'text/javascript');
    script1.setAttribute('src',url);
    if(defer == true){
        script1.setAttribute('defer','defer');
    }
    document.head.appendChild(script1);
}
function loadScript1(url, callback){

    var script = document.createElement("script")
    script.type = "text/javascript";
    if (script.readyState){  //IE
        script.onreadystatechange = function(){
            if (script.readyState == "loaded" || script.readyState == "complete"){
                script.onreadystatechange = null;
                callback();
            }
        };
    } else {  //Others
        script.onload = function(){
            callback();
        };
    }
    script.src = url;
    document.getElementsByTagName("head")[0].appendChild(script);
}
if(referer == "Prisma" || referer == "Cortex" || referer == "Sase" || referer == "Unit" || referer == "Ngfw"){
	if(referer == "Unit"){
    setTimeout(function(){
      loadScript(main_site_criticalTopBase, false);
      loadScript1(main_site_criticalTopProductNav, function(){
        window.PAN_initializeProduct2021Nav();
      });
      loadScript(main_site_defered, false);
    }, 3000);
	}
	else{
    setTimeout(function(){
      loadScript1(main_site_critical_top, function(){
        window.PAN_initializeProduct2021Nav();
      });
      loadScript(main_site_defered, false);
    }, 3000);
	}
}

$(document).ready(function () {
    setTimeout(function(){
      $('.article-banner .ab__options ul li a').each(function(){
          	$(this).attr('target', "_blank");
      });
    }, 4000);
});
</script>
<!--  End: Scripts Migrated From Unit42-v5 -->

</body>
</html>
